name: My First Website
description2: It's not much as to be expected, just kept here to see where I come from :)

name: Library Simulator
description1: A library simulator written in ruby tested with rspec:
description2: Users can create a collection, add books to it, people can take out and return books. The application was made to practice basic concepts of application design test driven development and collaboration

name: ATM simulator
description1: An ATM simulator written in ruby tested with rspec:
description2: Users can make account, deposit, withdraw, get a job and work. The application was made to pratice test driven development, pair programming and the connection between classes.

name: BMI Calcultator
description1: A simple BMI calculator written in JavaScript tested with cucumber:
description2: User can calculate his/her BMI with a toggle for changing from metric to imperial method. The application was made to pratice JS concepct, testing in JS using cucumber.

name: Address Book
description1: An address book written in JavaScript using browser local storage for storing contacts and cucumber for testing:
description2: The user can add contacts and which are being stored and displayed on the page. The application was made to practice local storage in the browser, and testing in javascript with cucumber

name: Moe's Tavern
description1: An online food ordering application created using Ruby on Rails as full stack framework, cucumber/rspec for testing and tailwind for styling:
description2: The user can register pick from menu and checkout. The owner can create update and delete food items from menu. The application follows the simpsons theme.

name: Crafty News
description1: A newsite prototype created using Ruby on Rails as full stack framework, cucumber/rspec for testing and tailwind for styling:
description2: Users can register and read news articles. Articles are stored locally and also fetched from a 3rd party API. The fetched news change based on the language selected. Current weather is fetched using geolocator and 3rd party API. Basic CRUD actions implemented, different roles added.

name: CARDnD
description1: A car sharing service prototype created using Ruby on Rails as full stack framework, cucumber/rspec for testing and tailwind for styling:
description2: Users can register, select a car and pay using their credit cards via Stripe.

name: Tribal
description1: A social fitness application prototype created using React on Rails which is rails backend and react frontend, cucumber/rspec for testing and tailwind for styling:
description2: Main features include: pricing based on number of participant. 2 step payment, first it is reserved on your account and at start date it is deducted based on the number of participants. Video conferencing for sessions. Facebook login and sharing.

name: Cooper test on mobile
description1: A cooper test mobile application created using Ionic as mobile framework, Rails as backend API, tested with jasmine/karma:
description2: Users can register and log in and clock their runs. The data is stored in the rails API.
